title: Sri Lanka launches digital Shrimp Industry Information System to boost aquaculture sector
byline: The Shrimp Industry Information System (SIIS) was officially launched a short while ago by Fisheries Minister Ramalingam Chandrasekar, marking a major step in the digital transformation of Sri Lanka’s shrimp farming sector.

title: SJB MP Seeks Bribery, Audit Inquiry into Rs.5B allocation for Estate Workers
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP for the Matale district Rohini Kaviratne has sought the intervention of the Bribery Commission and the Auditor General to intervene to ensure whether the allocation of Rs. 5 billion in the budget for the payment of Rs.200 each to estate workers belonging to private plantation companies.

title: A wave of doctors’ strikes around the corner?
byline: Sri Lanka’s public health sector is showing signs of deep unrest, with two major doctors’ unions warning that continued government inaction could soon lead to nationwide protests or even strikes.

title: Over 2700 govt. buildings lie idle
byline: In what appeared to be another instance of multi-billion rupee waste of taxpayers’ money, more than 2700 government buildings, constructed in the past, remain abandoned or not being used properly, according to the budget speech delivered by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Sri Lankan team to continue Pakistan tour; ODIs on Nov. 14 & 16 in Rawalpindi
byline: The Sri Lankan cricket team has agreed to remain in Pakistan and continue their ongoing tour, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said.

title: Gold prices rise sharply following global spike
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have recorded a sharp increase, mirroring a significant surge in the global market where prices crossed US$ 4,212 per ounce today.

title: Arrest warrant issued against former National Lotteries Board Director
byline: The Colombo Additional Magistrate, Lahiru Silva, today issued an arrest warrant against former Director of the National Lotteries Board, Thusitha Halloluwa.

title: Dayasiri, Marikkar brawl with Minister Vidyaratne
byline: Opposition MPs S.M. Marikkar and Dayasiri Jayasekera engaged in a heated argument with Minister Samantha Vidyaratne in Parliament today over privilege issues.

title: Bangladesh braces for disruptions as former ruling party calls for lockdown to protest Hasina trial
byline: Classes and transportation in Bangladesh were seriously disrupted Thursday as ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and her former ruling Awami League party called for a nationwide “lockdown” in protest against her trial over last year’s protests that left hundreds dead.

title: Sri Lanka’s construction industry faces sharp GDP decline
byline: The contribution of Sri Lanka’s construction industry to the national Gross Domestic Product (GDP), which once stood at 9%, has now fallen to between 3.5% and 6%, Sri Lanka Construction Association Chairman Susantha Liyanarachchi said.

title: Committee submits report recommending repeal of PTA
byline: A committee report containing recommendations for the repeal of Sri Lanka’s Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) has been submitted to Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara.

title: Trump signs spending bill to end longest shutdown in US history
byline: President Donald Trump has signed a spending bill to reopen the government and end the longest shutdown in US history.

title: ‘Vanasurekuma’ hotline records over 500 public complaints
byline: The Environment Ministry announced that more than 500 public complaints have been received through the 1995 short number of the “Vanasurekuma” center, which operates under the Ministry’s “Vanaspathi” environmental protection program.

title: Keeri Samba shortage created by large-scale mill owners: Minister
byline: Large-scale mill owners have hidden stocks of Keeri Samba rice, thus creating a shortage in the market, Minister of Trade Wasantha Samarasinghe told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka records birth of conjoined twin girls
byline: A pair of conjoined twin girls have been born at the Castle Street Hospital for Women in Colombo earlier this week (10), hospital officials confirmed.

title: Plans underway to relocate Galle prison for urban development
byline: Preparations are underway to remove the Galle Prison from its current location following a proposal made at the recent Galle District Coordination Committee meeting.

title: Clarification
byline: With reference to the Daily Mirror lead story dated 12th November 2025 titled “Rs.200 allowance for estate workers – President’s Budgetary Proposal deemed unlawful - CoPF” the Parliament Secretariat has sent the following clarification.

title: World’s first flying car factory begins production in China
byline: Aridge, Xpeng’s flying car subsidiary, has started trial production at the world’s first flying car factory in Guangzhou.

title: ICTA warns against unauthorized use of logo by training institutes
byline: The Information and Communication Technology Agency (ICTA) has issued a public warning against unauthorized use of its logo by training institutes.

title: GMOA calls emergency meeting over 2026 budget, Warns of public health risks
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has summoned specialist doctors from across Sri Lanka this week for urgent consultations on the proposed 2026 national budget, raising alarms over potential impacts on the country’s free healthcare system.

title: FR Petition on May 9 property damage compensation fixed for January 28
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition filed seeking an order directing authorities to conduct an investigation into the compensation payments made for damages caused to properties during the illegal attacks and violence carried out by groups of wrongdoers on May 9, 2022, was today fixed for January 28 by the Supreme Court.

title: Digambaram tells Namal not to oppose plantation workers’ wage hike
byline: While admiring the government’s decision to allocate Rs. 5,000 million to increase the wages of the plantation workers, Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) MP Palani Digambaram today urged opposition MPs such as Namal Rajapaksa and Nizam Kariapper not to oppose the allocation of state funds for the matter.

title: Happy to be called ’father of brown sugar’: Handunnetti
byline: Claiming that social media has started to call him ’father of brown sugar’ after the opening of a brown sugar outlet in Nugegoda recently, Industries Minister Sunil Handunnetti said today he is happy to be called the ’father of brown sugar’ rather than ’father of white sugar’.

title: 6 Blasts in Delhi-NCR on December 6: ’Doctor Module’ had babri revenge plan
byline: Investigators probing the blast near Delhi’s iconic Red Fort have unearthed a chilling plan: the suspected terror module involving doctors allegedly linked to Jaish-e-Mohammad had planned blasts at six locations in the National Capital Region on December 6.

title: Daily mirror report on plantation workers’ payments comes to limelight in Parliament
byline: The story published by the Daily Mirror yesterday (November 12, 2025) under the title ’SJB MP seeks bribery. Audit inquiry into Rs. 56 billion allocation for estate workers’’ came to the limelight in Parliament today when Deputy Minister Sugath Thilakaratne quoted it.

title: Air Force Target Top-Four Finish
byline: Air Force Sports Club is eyeing a top-four finish ahead of the inter club league rugby tournament which gets underway on Friday and play their first match against Army Sports Club at Ratmalana on the following day.

title: Afghans carried out two suicide bombings in Pakistan, says minister
byline: Pakistan said on Thursday Afghan nationals carried out two deadly suicide bombings in its territory this week, amid sharpening tensions between the South Asian neighbours over militant violence.

title: Suspect arrested over illegally acquired assets worth Rs. 30 million
byline: The Illegal Assets Investigation Division has commenced further investigations under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act against a resident of the Eheliyagoda area, suspected of acquiring assets through illegal drug and alcohol trafficking.

title: Elections Commissioner General Saman Sri Ratnayake retires
byline: Commissioner General of Elections Saman Sri Ratnayake has retired from his post and from state service, effective today (13).

title: CSE pulls back as banking counters drag indices lower
byline: After a strong bullish run in recent sessions, the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) took a breather today, with the ASPI falling 198 points as heavyweight banking counters pulled the index down. Investor sentiment turned cautious, with profit-taking seen across key blue-chip counters amid unmet earnings expectations, shifting overall market momentum into negative territory.

title: MPs’ vehicle permits stopped during Gota’s time: D.V. Chanaka
byline: Claiming that the government was bragging about stopping vehicle permits given to Parliamentarians, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP D.V. Chanaka said today MPs’ vehicle permits were stopped by former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa in 2020.

title: Non-alcoholic beverages can’t be sold as gin, EU court rules
byline: The name ’gin’ is reserved solely for alcoholic beverages, the European Court of Justice ruled on Thursday.

title: Sri Lanka invites Pope Leo XIV to mark 50 years of diplomatic ties
byline: Sri Lanka has extended an invitation to His Holiness Pope Leo XIV to undertake an official visit to the country, reaffirming the deepening friendship between Sri Lanka and the Holy See as both nations mark 50 years of diplomatic relations, the Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment & Tourism Ministry said.

title: One in five Sri Lankan adults diagnosed with diabetes
byline: Health experts have raised concern over the growing number of diabetes cases in Sri Lanka, revealing that one in five adults in the country is now living with the disease.

title: Field Marshal steps in to protect Sri Lankan Cricket Team in Pakistan
byline: Pakistan’s Army Chief, Field Marshal General Syed Asim Munir, has assured full security to the visiting Sri Lankan cricket team, Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi said on Thursday. The assurance came after Sri Lankan officials raised concerns following recent security incidents in Islamabad. Naqvi said the matter was personally discussed with Sri Lankan leaders.

title: Dodangoda Pradeshiya Sabha rejects inaugural Budget of NPP
byline: The inaugural budget of the Dodangoda Pradeshiya Sabha, presented under the chairmanship of the National People’s Power (NPP) Party, was defeated today.
